8-11-1932.monologue: A new day, a new story to tell.

start.text: I know what are you thinking. That I'm going to sell the newspaper.

options.text: you are right, and I think is not correct
Are you thinking to sell the newspaper?

A.text: Have you take a look to the sales Ben? We are in red numbers for so long.

options.text: We are working in a good story, just give us one month more.
The economy is a little bit difficult this days, but you will se that this newspaper is going to sell a lot.

B.text: Ben, this is difficult and you know it, but I'm not running this newspaper for charity. We need to make money.

AEnd.text: Ok, you have one month to increase the sales, after that I can't promise you anything.

news.headline: Free food for everyone!
news.lead: The popular millionaire Andy Montana offers charity banquets in the poorest areas of the city.

news.headline: The strike continues on Soup & Pastas
news.lead: Third day of strike, estimated losses for 100 dollars.

news.headline: Annette Gray will sing at the South Hall
news.lead: The famous singer will perform this May 5th with the band Underground Boys.

news.headline: Ernest Jones the 5th race for veterans
news.lead: The city is preparing for the event that will raise funds for veterans of the Great War.

news.headline: Marta Robinson's store house was robbed
news.lead: Yesterday around 200 dollars in merchandise were stolen from the popular store.
